content: An interesting read. I had to laugh when he said he didn’t want to drive on his commute; he wanted to be driven. There’s an age gap because I don’t want a commute; I want to telecommute. I think it’s nice that he checks with his son as he can follow him into his business but those kids who don’t have a rich father, what profession will they have in this new world? I see a world where machines do everything and people have limited ways to make money which is needed to live. I don’t know how that’s going to shake out but I can say that I am completely happy that I’m in the last 3rd of my life and won’t be working for many more years. But, the future of the young does concern me. And, he should be more concerned about the environment that his kid will live in rather than space hotels. As long as there’s a buck to be made…
